name: awearness
tagline: a simple vibrating/flashing wristband to remind you!
body:
# awearness
## What is awearness?
awearness is a simple wristband created during [JugendHackt](http://jugendhackt.de) 2014 (a yearly hackathon for humans between 11 and 18 years in Berlin).

Actually it is quite simple: A 3d-printed wristband which connects to a smartphone via Bluetooth. The smartphone then is able to trigger the built-in vibration motor or LEDs of the wristband. The idea is to remind you or make you aware of certain things. For example:

* a surveillance camera is nearby
* you're in front of a supermarket and need to buy something
* you're driving to fast
* ...

## Where can I get it?
awearness is – as you might guess – an open-source wristband. You can find the code that was pushed while JugendHackt in [Jugendhackt/awearness](https://github.com/jugendhackt/awearness). We'll move the repositories to the awearness organization and push the missing code soon!

To have a real wristband you might want to print it yourself (note that the current design is not yet ready and not in the repo). Then you might want to get a [RFduino](http://rfduino.com) and equip it with the [firmware from the repo](https://github.com/Jugendhackt/awearness/blob/master/bluetooth-wristband/bluetooth-wristband.ino). The corresponding Android-App is also not ready yet and there's (sadly) no iOS-Dev in our team (yet)

## The wristband
The wristband itself is 3d-printed what gives surprising good results.

This is a picture of [the first prototype](https://github.com/Jugendhackt/awearness/commit/0d2273f3fde345a29f7bfb83331e38b4e3297423):
